title: Question 14
prompt: <u>The painter created a mural. She created it on an expensive, high-quality canvas.</u>
description: Read the underlined sentences.  Then choose the sentence that best combines those sentences into one.
feedback:
The best combination of the two sentences is, “The painter created a mural on an expensive, high-quality canvas.” Since both sentences have the same subject and verb, “the painter created,” it makes sense to include both ideas in one independent clause. This choice contains the least redundant ideas.

The sentence “The painter created a mural, and she created it on an expensive high-quality canvas” has a redundant subject and verb in each independent clause. The same ideas are expressed more concisely in the correct response. This choice also is missing a comma between the adjectives “expensive” and “high-quality.”

The sentence “The painter created a, mural, and she created it on an expensive, high-quality canvas” also has a redundant subject and verb. Additionally, it has an unneeded comma after the word “a.”

The sentence “The painter created a mural and she created it on an expensive high-quality canvas” contains a redundant subject and verb and is missing a comma before the coordinating conjunction “and.”
